<McCarren Park
New York City Department of Parks and Recreation
3:
--------------------
Text: McCarren Park:  Opened in 1906 and originally named Greenpoint Park, the park was renamed McCarren Park in 1909 after State Senator Patrick H. McCarren (1849-1909), who began work as a cooper at Williamsburg sugar refineries and eventually became the Democratic boss of Brooklyn.

Triplets:<McCarren Park
4:
--------------------
<Text: McCarren Park:  The park is a popular destination for recreational softball, volleyball, soccer, handball, and other games.>
Triplets:<McCarren Park
5:
--------------------
Text: McCarren Park:  It is also used for sunbathing and dog-walking.

Triplets:<McCarren Park
6:
--------------------
Text: McCarren Park:  In late 2004, the park's track was resurfaced and has been a popular destination for running enthusiasts.
Triplets:<McCarren Park
